unnormalised: **Auto Buzz: New Wheels Hit Indian Roads!**
normalised: **Auto Buzz: New Wheels Hit Indian Roads!**

unnormalised: Folks, the automotive scene is heating up faster than a tawa on a Delhi summer day! This week saw a flurry of vehicle launches, from souped-up SUVs to budget-friendly hatchbacks.
normalised: Folks, the automotive scene is heating up faster than a tawa on a Delhi summer day! This week saw a flurry of vehicle launches, from souped up S U Vs to budget friendly hatchbacks.

unnormalised: First up, Mahindra unveiled its latest XUV variant with a swanky new infotainment system. Dr. Verma, their head of design, promised "unparalleled driving pleasure." They're aiming for the Diwali rush, naturally.
normalised: First up, Mahindra unveiled its latest X U V variant with a swanky new infotainment system. Doctor Verma, their head of design, promised "unparalleled driving pleasure." They're aiming for the Diwali rush, naturally.

unnormalised: Then there's Maruti Suzuki, who launched their fuel-efficient Celerio CNG, targeting the cost-conscious crowd. Rumours say it gives close to 35 km/kg!
normalised: Then there's Maruti Suzuki, who launched their fuel efficient Celerio C N G, targeting the cost conscious crowd. Rumours say it gives close to thirty five kilometer per kilogram!

unnormalised: Tata Motors also jumped into the fray with a refreshed version of the Nexon EV, boasting a bigger battery pack and longer range, perfect for tackling Bangalore's traffic.
normalised: Tata Motors also jumped into the fray with a refreshed version of the Nexon E V, boasting a bigger battery pack and longer range, perfect for tackling Bangalore's traffic.

unnormalised: And finally, a homegrown startup, "Desi Motors," unveiled their first electric scooter. They claim it's made entirely from recycled materials and costs under Rs. 50,000. Their factory in Nagpur spans 20,000 sq ft! Talk about Swadeshi! Will it be a game-changer? We'll keep you posted!
normalised: And finally, a homegrown startup, "Desi Motors," unveiled their first electric scooter. They claim it's made entirely from recycled materials and costs under rupee fifty thousand. Their factory in Nagpur spans twenty thousand square feet! Talk about Swadeshi! Will it be a game changer? We'll keep you posted!
